description: The cause of the vulnerabilities in Microsoft SQL Server stems from a series of remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities that allow attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected systems. Specifically, CVE-2024-38074, CVE-2024-38076, and other related vulnerabilities rated 8.8/10 on the CVSS scale pose considerable risks if not patched immediately. These vulnerabilities can lead to unauthorized access and compromise database integrity, making immediate patching essential for maintaining network security. Furthermore, vulnerabilities in the Windows Remote Desktop Licensing Service and the Windows Layer Two Bridge network exacerbate the security threats, highlighting the critical need for stringent security measures and network best practices to prevent exposure and attacks. The described flaws affect not only SQL Server but various components within the Microsoft ecosystem, emphasizing the urgency of applying the corresponding KB Articles for resolutions, particularly KB38077, KB38074, KB38076, and others related to these vulnerabilities.
